description: A method to adjust the target version of Windows Update settings for Windows 11 (22H2). By changing the target version, administrators can control which updates are offered to end-user machines. This can help ensure that only specific feature updates are rolled out, rather than major upgrades, which may not be ready for deployment. The modification is made through the registry key '[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate]' with adjustments to the 'ProductVersion', 'TargetReleaseVersion', and 'TargetReleaseVersionInfo' to manage update availability effectively.
